data.meanings: to serve, worship or adore; to protect, grant refuge, preserve save, rescue, liberate; object of worship ie God; (Alif-Lam-Lam-ha) God, the one true God applied as a proper name denoting the true god, comprising all the excellent divine names; a unity comprising all the essences of existing things.
data.sentence: The word اللَّهِ comes from the root ا ل ه and is associated with the meanings: to serve, worship or adore; to protect, grant refuge, preserve save, rescue, liberate; object of worship ie God; (Alif-Lam-Lam-ha) God, the one true God applied as a proper name denoting the true god, comprising all the excellent divine names; a unity comprising all the essences of existing things.

The word هُوَ comes from the root ه و and is associated with the meanings: huwa = He (pronoun. masculine 3rd. sing.)

data.meanings: a path which is even, wide enough and can be trodden without difficulty. A road/way/path, long sword.
data.sentence: The word صِرَاطٍ comes from the root ص ر ط and is associated with the meanings: a path which is even, wide enough and can be trodden without difficulty. A road/way/path, long sword.

data.meanings: stand still or firm, rose/stand up, managed/conducted/ordered/regulated/superintended, established, made it straight/right, maintain/erect/observe/perform, set up, people/community/company, abode, stature/dignity/rank. aqama - to keep a thing or an affair in a right state.
data.sentence: The word مُسْتَقِيمٍ comes from the root ق و م and is associated with the meanings: stand still or firm, rose/stand up, managed/conducted/ordered/regulated/superintended, established, made it straight/right, maintain/erect/observe/perform, set up, people/community/company, abode, stature/dignity/rank. aqama - to keep a thing or an affair in a right state.

data.meanings: (or Dal-Ba with a tashdeed on the Ba) to go gently, crawl/creep/walk, hit, expine, flow, throw.Whatsoever moves on earth especially beasts of burden, quadraped, beast, moving creature, insect, creature on earth, materialistic person whose endeavors are wholly directed to the acquisition of worldy riches and material comforts and who has fallen on the pleasures of this world with all his might and main.
data.sentence: The word دَابَّةٍ comes from the root د ب ب and is associated with the meanings: (or Dal-Ba with a tashdeed on the Ba) to go gently, crawl/creep/walk, hit, expine, flow, throw.Whatsoever moves on earth especially beasts of burden, quadraped, beast, moving creature, insect, creature on earth, materialistic person whose endeavors are wholly directed to the acquisition of worldy riches and material comforts and who has fallen on the pleasures of this world with all his might and main.

data.meanings: to be a lord and master, collect, possess/owner, rule, increase, complete, bring up, preserve, chief, determiner, provider, sustainer, perfecter, rewarder, creator, maintainer, reposer of properties, developer, former of rules and laws of the growth, foster a thing in such a manner as to make it attain one condition after another until it reaches its goal of completion.

data.meanings: to entrust, confirm, give, charge, dispose affairs, lean upon, reply upon.
data.sentence: The word تَوَكَّلْتُ comes from the root و ك ل and is associated with the meanings: to entrust, confirm, give, charge, dispose affairs, lean upon, reply upon.
